cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 1185 MI...1910 KM E OF SOUTH POINT HAWAII
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP2 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Depression Greg Advisory Number 34 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP072017 200 PM PDT Tue Jul 25 2017
...GREG WEAKENS TO A TROPICAL DEPRESSION...
SUMMARY OF 200 PM PDT...2100 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...16.2N 137.9W ABOUT 1185 MI...1910 KM E OF SOUTH POINT HAWAII MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...35 MPH...55 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...WNW OR 295 DEGREES AT 12 MPH...19 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1005 MB...29.68 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 200 PM PDT (2100 UTC), the center of Tropical Depression Greg was located near latitude 16.2 North, longitude 137.9 West. Greg is moving toward the west-northwest near 12 mph (19 km/h), and this general motion is expected to continue through Wednesday. A turn toward the west is forecast Wednesday night and Thursday.
Maximum sustained winds have decreased to near 35 mph (55 km/h) with higher gusts. Additional weakening is expected during the next couple of days, and Greg is forecast to degenerate into a remnant low by Wednesday night.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1005 mb (29.68 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 800 PM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Berg
NNNN
